intro: Parathesis micranthera, commonly known as the small-flowered parathesis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in cymes. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. Parathesis micranthera is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
